user_question: Can you explain how a tornado forms and generate an image of a tornado?
final_answer: A tornado forms from a supercell thunderstorm when warm, moist air meets cold, dry air, creating a rotating updraft. Image of a tornado generated. Tornadoes require warm, moist air at the surface, cold, dry air aloft, and wind shear to create rotation.
